text: I'm not insulting you, I'm describing you.
I'm jealous of people who don't know you.
You're not the dumbest person on earth, but you better hope they don't die.
I thought of you today. It reminded me to take out the trash.
You have an entire life to be an idiot. Why not take today off?
Your face makes onions cry.
You're not stupid; you just have bad luck thinking.
I have nothing but respect for you -- and not much of that.
Thank you for your input. (Then change the subject.)
As an outsider, what is your perspective on intelligence?
I wish we could become better strangers.
I would challenge you to a battle of wits, but I see you are unarmed!
Clearly you've been educated beyond your capacity for thought.
My days of not taking you seriously are certainly coming to a middle.
I take it you weren't burdened with an overabundance of schooling.
I wish that for a moment you could stand in my shoes, then you'd know what a drag it is to see you.
Stop wasting your breath.
You're impossible to underestimate.
Whoever told you to be yourself simply couldn't have given you worse advice.
You have an impeccable grasp of the obvious.
There is nothing you can do that will make me think less of you.
You are like the first piece of bread in a loaf. Everybody touches you but nobody wants you.
You haven't been yourself lately. We've all noticed the improvement.
You are the human equivalent of a participation award.
I envy people who haven't met you.
In the morning I shall be sober, but you will still be ugly.
I've been called worse things by better people.
I don't know why you're playing hard to get when you're so hard to want.
I hope the rest of your day is as pleasant as you are.
You should eat the make-up. Then you can be pretty on the inside.
Everyone who ever loved you was wrong.
I hope that both sides of your pillow are warm when you go to bed tonight.
Don't listen to what everyone says about you, you're alright.
Now I know why people talk about you behind your back.
Thank you. We're all refreshed and challenged by your unique point of view.
I don't know what your problem is, but I bet it's hard to pronounce.
If you had brains you would be dangerous.
You're not pretty enough to be this stupid.
I am sure you did your best.
I can explain it to you, but I can't understand it for you.
I don't have the time or the crayons to explain this to you right now.
Who do I have to donate money to get you help?
If I wanted to kill myself I would climb your ego and jump to your IQ.
I'm sorry I hurt your feelings when I called you stupid, I really thought you already knew.
It's ok if you disagree with me, I can't force you to be right.
I'm busy right now, can I ignore you some other time?
I'm sorry I offended you with my common sense.
The last thing I want to do is hurt you... But it's still on the list.
Your mom should've swallowed.
You're twice as dumb and half as smart as you think you are.
You are unworthy of the lego you stepped on.
Were you born this way or did you have an accident?
Your mother dresses you funny.
You've got a great face for the radio business.
I could agree with you, but then we'd both be wrong.
You're about as useful as Anne Frank's drum set.
You deprive me of privacy without providing the benefit of company.
Your face looks like something I drew with my left hand.
If your IQ was any lower I'd have to water you twice a day.
You are selectively competent.
You're the reason no one likes you.
You've never been accused of being intelligent have you?
You were meant to be a blow job.
Were you born stupid, or did you grow that way?
At your level, even breathing must be an achievement.
I'd call you a cunt, but you have neither the warmth nor the depth.
Bless your heart.
You'll have a lightly attended funeral.
I think you have your ambitions and abilities mixed up.
You are every bit as charming as I'd imagined.
You're living proof that some village somewhere is missing it's idiot.
That's really good for a person like you.
I would unplug your life support to charge my phone.
I have so many questions for your parents.
Most people just tolerate you.
I hope your next meal is disappointing.
I hope you step on a lego.
I see you've set aside this special time to humiliate yourself in public.
I will always cherish the initial misconceptions I had about you.
Did the middle of my sentence interrupt the start of yours?
May the chocolate chips in your cookies always turn out to be raisins.
May every sock you wear be slightly rotated, just enough for it to be uncomfortable.
May you forever feel your cellphone vibrating in the pocket it's not even in.
May you always get up from your computer with your headphones still attached.
May your chair produce a sound similar to a fart, but only once, such that you cannot reproduce it to prove that it was just the chair.
May your five year old neighbour have his violin lessons during all of your hangovers.
May you always step in a wet spot after putting on fresh socks.
May your tea be too hot when you receive it, and too cold by the time you remember it's there.
May your cookie always be slightly too large to fit inside your glass of milk.
May the pin of the bathroom stall never reach the lock to close the door.
May you never be quite certain whether that pressure is a fart or poop.
May your spoon always slip and sink under the hot soup you eat.
I love how you state the obvious with such a sense of discovery.
I hope you can never find the right water temperature when you shower.
I would insult you but nature did a better job.
I'd love to see things from your perspective, but I don't think I could shove my head that far up my ass.
You're the reason the gene pool needs a lifeguard.
You did a really good job tying your shoes this morning. We're all really proud of you and what you're able to accomplish.
That little voice in the back of your head, telling you you'll never be good enough? It's right.
If I was in a room with you, Osama bin Laden and Hitler and I had a gun and only two bullets, I'd shoot you twice.
You have the personality of wallpaper.
I considered your point of view and decided to move on with my life.
Excuse me for talking while you're interrupting.
The world is full of all kinds of beautiful stuff. But then there's you, ruining it.
I hope your shower runs out of hot water as soon as you start shampooing.
I hope someone drives slightly slower than you'd like on a busy road.
I hope you go into a room and forget why you went in there.
Nothing brightens up a room like your absence.
I love the sound you make when you shut up.
The reason why you get easily lost in thought is because it's unfamiliar territory.
I'd insult you, but you're not bright enough to notice.
Don't ask me any questions, I just might tell you the truth.
I'd love to go out with you, but I'm attending the opening of my garage door.
How many times do I have to flush to get rid of you?
I like you. You remind me of when I was young and stupid.
Here is some money, call someone who cares.
If I want your opinion, I'll ask you to fill out the necessary forms.
I'd explain it to you, but your brain would explode.
Ever since I saw you in your family tree, I've wanted to cut it down.
Brains aren't everything. In your case they're nothing.
Don't you need a license to be that ugly?
Are you always an idiot, or just when I'm around?
You remind me of the ocean -- you make me sick.
When you die, I'd like to go to your funeral, but I'll probably go to work that day. I believe in business before pleasure.
I don't mind that you are talking so long as you don't mind that I'm not listening.
If ignorance is bliss, you must be the happiest person on earth.
If I told you that I have a piece of dirt in my eye, would you move?
If ugly were a crime, you'd get a life sentence.
You're so dense, light bends around you.
Sorry but you've obviously mistaken me for someone who gives a damn.
Sit down and give your mind a rest.
Sure, I've seen people like you before -- but I had to pay an admission.
Everyone is entitled to be stupid, but you abuse the privilege.
